member.name: P:MXit.User.IUserInfo.CurrentCountry
member.summary:
User's current (roaming) country code.
This is a best estimate of the user's current location, based on the IPs via which the user connects to MXit's platform. While this information should be fairly accurate, there is no guarantee that the information will always be available or correct.
The country is returned as a 2-character uppercase string that conforms to ISO-3166-1 Alpha-2.

member.name: P:MXit.User.IUserInfo.CurrentRegion
member.summary:
User's current (roaming) region code.
You can use the following sources to interpret the region code: http://www.maxmind.com/app/fips10_4 http://www.maxmind.com/app/iso3166_2
This is a best estimate of the user's current location, based on the IPs via which the user connects to MXit's platform. While this information should be fairly accurate, there is no guarantee that the information will always be available or correct.

member.name: P:MXit.User.IUserInfo.CurrentCity

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.Message.MaySpool
member.summary:
Flag to indicate if this message may be spooled. Default is false.
If the message may be spooled, and the recipient user is offline at the time when the message is sent, the message will be kept for a few days and delivered the moment the user comes back online. The amount of time for which messages will be spooled before they are discarded is configured on the spool server and depends mostly on available resources. In general you can expect a message to be kept for at least 24 hours.
If the message may not be spooled, and it is sent to an offline user, it will be immediately discarded.

member.summary: Message element to set the behaviour of a MXit client's chat screen, and install custom popup menus.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.MessageElement
member.summary:
Message elements / commands are handled seperately from custom forms (although the same parsing rules are used).
Each command MUST have the following parameters: op=cmd - shows that this a command type=thetype - the type of the command id=value - a crc32 that is used to check that the command is valid. To make the checking of the crc32 easier the id= parameter MUST be the last in the list of parameters
Each command COULD have the following parameters nm=thename - the name of the command. The client does not do anything with the name. It is just returned to the backend. It can be used to match request and responses. auto=true - if set the, command is executed without user intervention (eg. selmsg ignored/not needed) noshow=true - if set the, message is not shown to the client at all. This only really makes sense for auto messages. displaymsg=themsg - message that is displayed in the relevant conversation screen (as an info message e.g. in gray) upon completion of the command
Note: No replies are sent for unstructured auto commands
Each command MUST have the following parameters in the reply: type=cmdname - the type of the command err=errorcode - the error (result) code of the command
The following error codes are defined: err = 0 - success 1 - if sms could not be sent 2 - if there was a security exception (user denied access) 6 - the destination url (or telephone number) is not valid or does not point to a downloadable resource. 7 - invalid id

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.ISelectAction
member.summary:
Interface definition for an action that can be assigned to a cell, to make it selectable.
One or more items can be selected, depending on the numSelections value. Selections can be sent to the backend when a certain threshold is crossed (specified by numSelections), when the user clicks on submit, or can be used as part of the place operation
Instances are created via ITable.CreateAction

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.TableSendModeType
member.summary: Possible ways to send a table to a MXit user.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.TableSendModeType.Replace
member.summary: The default - all the table's data is sent with every message. No attempt is made to send only data that has changed.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.TableSendModeType.Update
member.summary:
Attempt to only send data that has been modified.
In this mode, if less than half the table cells were modified, only those cells are sent, each with it's coordinates. Header data like action lists, table style, style lists, etc. are only sent when they have changed. This mode assumes the client keeps a reference of the table and just updates the modifed parts.

member.summary: Chat screen behaviours for a MXit client.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.None
member.summary: No special behaviours.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.NoHeading
member.summary: Dont display a heading or tabs.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.FullScreen
member.summary:
Full screen mode - no heading, tabs or scroll bar.
The client's chat screen area dimensions are ignored (i.e. the whole screen is used).

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.Clear
member.summary: Clear previous messages when a new message is received.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.NoAlert
member.summary: Dont play an audible alert when a new message is received.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.NoPrefix
member.summary: Dont display the sender and timestamp of received messages as a message prefix.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.NotifyClientAreaChanged
member.summary: Send a get-chat-screen-information-message whenever the client area's dimensions change.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.ShowProgress
member.summary: Show a progress indicator whenever the client sends a command / link to a service, until the service responds. This config will also cause the command / link to NOT be echo'd on the client's chat screen.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.CloseTab
member.summary: Add a close tab option (if tabs are enabled) to the menus.

member.name: F:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ChatScreenBehaviourType.Default
member.summary:
A sensible default chat screen configuration for playing games.
This configuration combines the NoHeading, FullScreen, Clear and NoPrefix chat screen behaviours.

member.summary:
Message from one service to another. Used by service messages (e.g. if Tradepost needs to send an contact invite as a user).

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.FileReceived.HasRootContext
member.summary:
Indicates if the file was sent within a root context.
If the file was not sent from a root context, it means the service was reached when another service redirected to it, in the same context (contact) as the original service. In cases like this the application should allow the user to get back to the previous service, by including a "back" service redirect somewhere in its menu structure.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Table
member.summary:
A table that can be used to organise and display images from framesets.
A table is a rectangular grid containing a number of cells. Each data cell may refer to multiple framesets, which are drawn according to the drawing layer of each frameset.
This strategy allows one to stack images.
A data cell may also contain an operation (an action to take if that cell is selected).
A table is sized according to the images in its data cells.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ITable

A table is sized according to the images in its data cells.

member.name: M:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ITable.InsertCol(System.Int32)

If the index is out of range, the column is insert either at the beginning, or end of the table (depending on which side the index is out of range).

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.PlaceAction
member.summary:
An action that can be assigned to a cell, so that the cell may serve as the recipient (target) of a place action.
A place action will typically be assigned to cells where a game piece, that was picked up somewhere else, can be placed.
Instances are created via ITable.CreateAction

member.summary:
The frameset that must to be applied to the selected cell (the cell that was clicked on by the user, before the cell this action is assigned to was clicked on), when an item is placed in this cell.
Typically this frameset will remove an object from the selected cell. E.g. when a user moves a piece from one cell (the selected cell) to another cell (this cell, the target cell).

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.IPlaceAction.PlacedFrames
member.summary:
The frameset that must be applied to the target cell (i.e. the cell this action is assigned to), when an item is placed in the target cell.
Typically this frameset will place the object that used to be in the selected cell, in the target cell.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.IPlaceAction.Limit
member.summary: Maximum number of placements.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.IPlaceAction.AutoSubmit

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.NoAction
member.summary:
An action that can be assigned to a cell, so that nothing will happen (no action is taken) if that cell is selected.
This type of action will typically be assigned to a cell, if the contents of that cell is only meant to be viewed (i.e. no user input or interaction is expected).

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.InlineImage
member.summary:
Allow images to be displayed as part of the normal text in the conversation screen. This is intended for small images e.g. thumbnails. This feature also includes redoing the internal representation of objects in the conversation screen.
src - OPTIONAL - The full url from where the image must be downloaded sid - OPTIONAL - The store id that identifies this image uniquely within the user's store Must be in the users folder list. This is used with a multimedia (27) get file (8) call dat - OPTIONAL - The base64 encoded image data If included the image data is part of the message crc - OPTIONAL - The crc of an image, if present it MUST be the CRC of an image that is part of this message. algn - OPTIONAL - How the image should be aligned. Possible values are: 0x1 - left 0x2 - middle 0x4 - right flow - OPTIONAL - How text flows around the image Possible values are: 1 - inline with text (hight is adjusted as needed) 2 - wrap around image (must be left or right aligned) 3 - alone on line (no text wrapping around image) w - width of image (in pixels) h - height of image (in pixels) xo - OPTIONAL - x offset of image (within w x h area in which it is drawn) yo - OPTIONAL - y offset of image (within w x h area in which it is drawn) fw - OPTIONAL - horisontal size of image frame fh - OPTIONAL - vertical size of image frame t - OPTIONAL - the time between each frame cap - OPTIONAL - true/false - default true If set to false, the client should NOT attach capability information when performing an HTTP GET operation to retrieve an image. This option is only relevant if the src option is used. replymsg - OPTIONAL - Text that is added to the message screen (as if the user sent the message himself) when the image is selected. If present, then a selection rectangle is also drawn around the image when it receives the focus.

member.summary:
A text menu item.
Text menu items typically look like this:
m) My menu item
The 'm)' part of the menu item is selectable. The idea is that the user can either click on the 'm)' link, or just type 'm' to select the menu item.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.IMessageToSend.MaySpool
member.summary:
Flag to indicate if this message may be spooled.
If the message may be spooled, and the recipient user is offline at the time when the message is sent, the message will be kept for a few days and delivered the moment the user comes back online. The amount of time for which messages will be spooled before they are discarded is configured on the spool server and depends mostly on available resources. In general you can expect a message to be kept for at least 24 hours.
If the message may not be spooled, and it is sent to an offline user, it will be immediately discarded.

member.name: M:MXit.Messaging.MessageToSend.EscapeText(System.String)
member.summary:
Constructs a string that contains MXit markup where any reserved characters ( \ $ . # * _ / ) in the input string is escaped, so that they will be correctly interpreted by MXit clients.
If the input string contains MXit commands (::op=.........:), the command text will not be escaped.
member.param: Raw input containing un-escaped special characters.
member.returns: String that contains all the text in the input string, but with all reserved characters correctly escaped

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference
member.summary:
Interface definition for a reference to an image strip, for which the image data is stored remotely.
An image strip is an image that is logically broken up into a set of smaller images, or frames, that are all of equal size.
When an app sends an image strip to a MXit client, the client will cache the strip, so that the frames within the image strip can then referenced, without having to transfer the image data each time.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference.FrameWidth
member.summary: Width of a single frame in the strip.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference.FrameHeight
member.summary: Height of a single frame in the strip.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference.Layer
member.summary:
The layer number is used to order multiple image strips for the same set of table cells.
If multiple image strips are used to draw the data in the cells, the images are drawn in order of increasing layer numbers.
A layer of 0 would typically be the background, 1 the foreground and 2 the "selected" look.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference.FrameCount
member.summary: Number of frames in the strip.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.IImageStripReference.Validator
member.summary: A unique ID, sent to the client, that the client can use to request image strips it does not yet have.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageReceived.MaySpool
member.summary:
Flag to indicate if this message may be spooled. Default is false.
If the message may be spooled, and the recipient user is offline at the time when the message is sent, the message will be kept for a few days and delivered the moment the user comes back online. The amount of time for which messages will be spooled before they are discarded is configured on the spool server and depends mostly on available resources. In general you can expect a message to be kept for at least 24 hours.
If the message may not be spooled, and it is sent to an offline user, it will be immediately discarded.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageReceived.FromDevice
member.summary: Message sender's device.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageReceived.HasRootContext
member.summary:
Indicates if the message was sent within a root context.
If the message was not sent from a root context, it means the service was reached when another service redirected to it, in the same context (contact) as the original service. In cases like this the application should allow the user to get back to the previous service, by including a "back" service redirect somewhere in its menu structure.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.SelectableImage
member.summary:
Allow images to be displayed as part of the normal text in the conversation screen. This is intended for small images e.g. thumbnails. This feature also includes redoing the internal representation of objects in the conversation screen.
src - OPTIONAL - The full url from where the image must be downloaded sid - OPTIONAL - The store id that identifies this image uniquely within the user's store Must be in the users folder list. This is used with a multimedia (27) get file (8) call dat - OPTIONAL - The base64 encoded image data If included the image data is part of the message crc - OPTIONAL - The crc of an image, if present it MUST be the CRC of an image that is part of this message. algn - OPTIONAL - How the image should be aligned. Possible values are: 0x1 - left 0x2 - middle 0x4 - right flow - OPTIONAL - How text flows around the image Possible values are: 1 - inline with text (hight is adjusted as needed) 2 - wrap around image (must be left or right aligned) 3 - alone on line (no text wrapping around image) w - width of image (in pixels) h - height of image (in pixels) xo - OPTIONAL - x offset of image (within w x h area in which it is drawn) yo - OPTIONAL - y offset of image (within w x h area in which it is drawn) fw - OPTIONAL - horisontal size of image frame fh - OPTIONAL - vertical size of image frame t - OPTIONAL - the time between each frame cap - OPTIONAL - true/false - default true If set to false, the client should NOT attach capability information when performing an HTTP GET operation to retrieve an image. This option is only relevant if the src option is used. replymsg - OPTIONAL - Text that is added to the message screen (as if the user sent the message himself) when the image is selected. If present, then a selection rectangle is also drawn around the image when it receives the focus.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Actions.SelectAction
member.summary:
An action that can be assigned to a cell, to make it selectable.
One or more items can be selected, depending on the numSelections value. Selections can be sent to the backend when a certain threshold is crossed (specified by numSelections), when the user clicks on submit, or can be used as part of the place operation
Instances are created via ITable.CreateAction

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ImageStripReference
member.summary:
A reference to an image strip, for which the image data is stored remotely.
An image strip is an image that is logically broken up into a set of smaller images, or frames, that are all of equal size.
When an app sends an image strip to a MXit client, the client will cache the strip, so that the frames within the image strip can then referenced, without having to transfer the image data each time.

member.summary: Number of frames in the strip.

member.summary: A unique ID, sent to the client, that the client can use to request image strips it does not yet have.

member.name: P:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.ImageStripReference.Layer
member.summary:
The layer number is used to order multiple image strips for the same set of table cells.
If multiple image strips are used to draw the data in the cells, the images are drawn in order of increasing layer numbers.
A layer of 0 would typically be the background, 1 the foreground and 2 the "selected" look.

member.name: P:MXit.User.UserInfo.CurrentCountry
member.summary:
User's current (roaming) country code.
This is a best estimate of the user's current location, based on the IPs via which the user connects to MXit's platform. While this information should be fairly accurate, there is no guarantee that the information will always be available or correct.
The country is returned as a 2-character uppercase string that conforms to ISO-3166-1 Alpha-2.

member.summary:
User's current (roaming) region code.
You can use the following sources to interpret the region code: http://www.maxmind.com/app/fips10_4 http://www.maxmind.com/app/iso3166_2
This is a best estimate of the user's current location, based on the IPs via which the user connects to MXit's platform. While this information should be fairly accurate, there is no guarantee that the information will always be available or correct.

member.name: P:MXit.User.UserInfo.CurrentCity
member.summary:
User's current (roaming) city.
This is a best estimate of the user's current location, based on the IPs via which the user connects to MXit's platform. While this information should be fairly accurate, there is no guarantee that the information will always be available or correct.

member.name: T:MXit.Messaging.MessageElements.Browser
member.summary: Perform the MIDP 2.0 MIDlet.platformRequest command. This is used to open a browser or install an application.
member.remarks:
selmsg - the selectable message that is displayed to the user dest - the url that is used by the platformRequest function e.g. http://www.mxit.com/wap/mxitj/mxitj.jad to download and install a MXit application http://www.mxit.com/wap/ringtones/funkyjingle.wav to download a ringtone
NOTE: Most phones cannot open the wap browser without closing the MXit application - so only one ringtone/java app can be downloaded at a time. However, a phone call can usually be made without exiting from MXit.
Remember to escape the ":" character (":" should be "%3a")
